metadata.title: CVE-2023-4055 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
When the number of cookies per domain was exceeded in `document.cookie`,the actual cookie jar sent to the host was no longer consistent withexpected cookie jar state. This could have caused requests to be sent withsome cookies missing. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 116, Firefox ESR< 102.14, and Firefox ESR < 115.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
